That's not what `Expires` does.  `Expires` is an HTTP header that tells browsers and itermediate caches when the object is expected to be obsolete and should no longer be cached -- similar to `Cache-Control` but deprecated and largely useless.  [`x-amz-expiration`](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTObjectHEAD.html) is a read-only *response* header that tells you when S3 is planning to purge an object because of a bucket lifecycle policy, but you can't ask S3 to delete an object at an arbitrary time in the future.
